title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: A thrilling adventure of Odysseus returning home after the Trojan War.

title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry's fourth year at Hogwarts is filled with danger and a mysterious tournament.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the Deep South.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A mysterious millionaire’s obsession with a former lover unfolds in the roaring 20s.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling depiction of a totalitarian regime and constant surveillance.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield’s introspective journey through New York City.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The beginning of Harry Potter's magical journey at Hogwarts.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The spirited Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, society, and misunderstandings.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Paul Atreides must navigate political chaos on the desert planet Arrakis.

title: Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance
author: Robert M. Pirsig
description: A philosophical exploration disguised as a motorcycle road trip.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: A tale of heroes, gods, and war during the siege of Troy.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A gripping psychological drama about guilt, redemption, and morality.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A young girl finds solace in stealing books during Nazi Germany, narrated by Death.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society engineered for stability where individuality is lost.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A young boy survives a shipwreck with a Bengal tiger on a lifeboat.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: A detached man confronts absurdity after committing an unmotivated murder.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: The comedic and tragic tale of a man who becomes a knight to revive chivalry.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
description: A poetic tale about a young prince who travels from planet to planet.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: An exploration of human evolution, behavior, and the development of civilizations.
